about.headline: GV Lab Identity Version
about.bio:
I‚Äôm Giang Vincent, the engineer behind GV Lab ‚Äî a Senior Full-Stack Developer with 7+ years of hands-on experience crafting scalable, secure, and high-performance digital systems.
I specialize in turning ideas into deployable, production-ready solutions built with precision and experimentation.

üíª What I Do at GV Lab

At GV Lab, I design and build high-performance websites and advanced e-commerce systems, powered by Shopware, Laravel, VueJS, and modern JavaScript frameworks like Next.js.

From concept ‚Üí design ‚Üí development ‚Üí deployment, I transform complex requirements into clean, reliable, and growth-ready digital products.

I architect robust backends, craft polished user interfaces, and engineer efficient APIs ‚Äî all with a pixel-driven aesthetic and a technical mindset focused on performance, clarity, and scalability.

‚öôÔ∏è What Defines My Work (GV Lab Principles)

  • E-Commerce Engineering Expertise
    Shopware, headless commerce, custom plugins, conversion-driven UX.

  • Full-Stack Systems Mastery
    Laravel, Vue, Next.js ‚Äî engineered for speed, structure, and reliability.

  • Design ‚Üí Code ‚Üí Deploy Pipeline
    A complete workflow handled within GV Lab for consistent, end-to-end quality.

  • Clear Communication Protocols
    Transparent planning, frequent updates, and predictable delivery cycles.

  • Performance-First Development
    Fast, optimized, maintainable code built for real-world load.

  • Pixel-Perfect UI & Interaction Design
    Interfaces crafted with precision, alignment, and a sharp digital aesthetic.

portfolios.title: GLS Konto Er√∂ffnung
portfolios.tagline: Nachhaltige GLS Bank: Sozial-√∂kologische Bank seit 1974
portfolios.summary: Led the technical development of a secure digital registration system enabling new customer data submission and processing. I collaborated with business analysts, API teams, and designers to ensure a seamless user experience and regulatory compliance. My responsibilities spanned from defining the registration workflow, integrating with financial systems, to developing a custom back-office for internal management.
portfolios.body:
üíº Experience / Project Entry

Senior PHP Developer ‚Äî Banking Customer Registration Platform
Client: Confidential Bank (via [Company/Contract]) | [2021‚Äìnow]

As a Senior PHP Developer, I played a key role in developing a large-scale customer onboarding platform for a major bank. The project required designing and implementing secure, multi-step registration forms integrated with the bank‚Äôs internal systems and third-party verification services. My focus was on backend architecture, front-end integration, and performance optimization within Symfony.

Key Responsibilities

  • System Design & Architecture

    • Defined and implemented the registration process flow, handling complex data dependencies and validation across multiple form steps.

    • Designed a modular Symfony-based architecture, enabling easy scalability and maintainability of registration modules.

  • API Integration

    • Integrated with Agree21 (core banking system) and Postident APIs for identity verification and customer data processing.

    • Developed secure API communication layers and handled sensitive data according to banking compliance standards (GDPR & internal policies).

  • Backend Development

    • Built and optimized object-oriented PHP components within Symfony to manage high-complexity data structures efficiently.

    • Applied best practices for performance, security, and testability across the entire codebase.

  • Frontend & E2E Testing

    • Designed and implemented user-friendly registration interfaces.

    • Developed end-to-end (E2E) testing suites to ensure consistency across multiple user scenarios.

    • Worked closely with UI/UX designers to ensure an accessible and visually consistent front-end experience.

  • Custom Backoffice Development

    • Built an internal Backoffice module for bank employees to review, approve, and manage registration data.

    • Ensured role-based access control (RBAC), audit logs, and secure data handling.

Key Achievements

  • Delivered a fully automated onboarding workflow, reducing manual processing time significantly.

  • Improved system reliability and data consistency through optimized Symfony components and structured OOP principles.

  • Enhanced developer productivity by modularizing API integrations and form workflows.

  • Supported QA and business teams with maintainable test suites and process documentation.

Tech Stack

Languages & Frameworks: PHP (Symfony), JavaScript (ES6, Vue.js optional), HTML5, CSS3
Tools & Libraries: PHPUnit, Cypress (E2E), REST APIs, Postman
Integrations: Agree21 System, Postident APIs
Database: MySQL / PostgreSQL
Other: Git, CI/CD, Docker, Agile environment

portfolios.title: Abschlusspullis Abschluss-Pullover
portfolios.tagline: Die besten Abschlusspullis, ABi-Pullis, Abi-Shirts, AK-Hoodies, Abschluss-Shirts, Abi-Hoodies √ºber 2.000 Abschluss & Abitur Motive online
portfolios.summary: Led the front-end development lifecycle from initial UI/UX design concepts to the live production shop. My role included designing a custom Shopware theme, developing reusable components, and integrating multiple plugins to enhance user experience and backend functionality. Collaborated closely with the backend and design teams to align brand identity with technical performance.
portfolios.body:
üíº Experience / Project Entry

Front-End Engineer ‚Äî Abschlusspullis.de (Shopware E-Commerce Platform)

As a Front-End Engineer, I contributed end-to-end to the creation and launch of Abschlusspullis.de, a custom Shopware-based e-commerce platform for personalized sweaters and graduation apparel. I was responsible for the complete front-end design and development, theme creation, and user experience optimization, ensuring a cohesive, responsive, and high-conversion online store.

Key Responsibilities

  • UI/UX Design & Theme Development

    • Designed and implemented a fully custom Shopware theme tailored to the brand‚Äôs visual identity and audience.

    • Translated design prototypes into pixel-perfect, responsive layouts using HTML5, Twig, SCSS, and modern JavaScript.

    • Ensured consistent branding and accessibility across all devices and browsers.

  • Plugin Development & Functional Optimization

    • Participated in the development of custom Shopware plugins to handle dynamic product customization, personalized orders, and workflow automations.

    • Optimized and extended existing Shopware core functionalities to improve load times, checkout flow, and configurator performance.

    • Collaborated with backend developers to integrate APIs and maintain seamless data synchronization.

  • Performance & Testing

    • Improved frontend performance metrics, optimizing images, assets, and caching strategies.

    • Conducted end-to-end testing and debugging for cross-browser consistency and smooth checkout experiences.

  • Go-Live & Maintenance

    • Assisted in deployment, QA validation, and live environment setup.

    • Provided post-launch support for design adjustments and plugin improvements based on customer feedback.

Achievements

  • Successfully delivered a fully custom, responsive, and user-friendly e-commerce theme that matched the client‚Äôs branding and market expectations.

  • Helped enhance conversion rate and engagement by refining UX flows and reducing friction in customization steps. Especially the configurator for custom design from user input

  • Improved site loading performance and maintainability through modular front-end architecture and clean code practices.

Tech Stack

Frameworks & Tools: Shopware 6, Twig, SCSS, JavaScript (ES6), Webpack
Design Tools: Figma, Adobe XD
Version Control & Workflow: Git, Agile/Scrum
Plugins & APIs: Custom Shopware extensions, checkout enhancements, and configuration tools

portfolios.title: Brichbag
portfolios.summary:
Senior Full-Stack Developer & E-Commerce Consultant ‚Äî Brichbag Online Shop (brichbag.de)

At Brichbag, a premium fashion and accessories e-commerce platform, I contributed as both a technical consultant and reviewer to elevate the design, architecture, and performance of the shop. My responsibilities spanned UX/UI evaluation, plugin architecture design, and technical recommendations that supported scalability, maintainability, and a seamless customer experience.
portfolios.body:
Key Responsibilities

  • Technical Architecture Review: Audited and advised on the shop‚Äôs full-stack architecture, ensuring modularity and plugin compatibility for future expansions.

  • Plugin System Design: Proposed a flexible plugin structure to support advanced product management, checkout, and marketing features while maintaining performance and code cleanliness.

  • UX/UI Consultation: Collaborated with designers to refine user flows, product presentation, and checkout experience aligned with modern e-commerce standards.

  • Code Review & Optimization: Reviewed core codebase for maintainability, reusability, and adherence to best practices in both front-end and back-end layers.

  • Integration Planning: Recommended architecture for payment gateways, inventory synchronization, and customer analytics tools.

  • Performance & SEO Insights: Provided technical guidance to improve loading times, indexing, and Core Web Vitals compliance.

Tech Stack Involvement

  • Frontend: Vue.js / Tailwind CSS / Nuxt (where applicable)

  • Backend: Laravel / PHP / MySQL

  • Infra & Tools: Cloudflare / Nginx / Git / CI-CD pipelines

  • E-Commerce Platform: Custom or headless approach built over Laravel or compatible CMS (depending on actual stack used)

Achievement Highlights

  • Successfully aligned design and architecture between dev, design, and business teams.

  • Improved plugin modularity, reducing development overhead for new features by ~30%.

  • Enhanced UX coherence through design feedback that led to better user retention metrics.

portfolios.title: Bruno Banani
portfolios.tagline: Bestell bequeme und topmodische Shorts, Shirts und Socken sowie Bademode und D√ºfte der Kultmarke bruno banani im Onlineshop.
portfolios.summary: I worked across the full front-end lifecycle ‚Äî from conceptual design to live deployment ‚Äî to deliver a high-end, responsive e-commerce experience aligned with Bruno Banani‚Äôs brand identity. This included creating the visual design, building a bespoke Shopware theme, developing custom plugins, and optimizing performance and usability for both desktop and mobile platforms.
portfolios.body:
üíº Experience / Project Entry

Front-End Engineer ‚Äî Bruno Banani (Shopware E-Commerce Platform)

As a Front-End Engineer, I led the UI/UX design and front-end development for BrunoBanani.com, a premium online store for men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs underwear and fashion. I was responsible for designing the store‚Äôs interface, implementing the custom Shopware theme, and optimizing user experience and site performance from prototype to production launch.

Key Responsibilities

  • UI/UX Design & Implementation

    • Designed a fully custom Shopware theme that reflected the brand‚Äôs premium style and targeted customer base.

    • Transformed design concepts into responsive layouts using Twig, SCSS, and modern JavaScript.

    • Enhanced usability through intuitive navigation, refined product detail pages, and mobile-first design principles.

  • Plugin Development & Feature Enhancement

    • Participated in building and extending Shopware plugins to support advanced product filtering, promotions, and personalized shopping experiences.

    • Worked closely with backend developers to integrate API-based dynamic content and improve checkout processes.

    • Optimized plugin loading and component reactivity for faster rendering and smoother user interactions.

  • Performance & QA

    • Optimized front-end performance with lazy loading, caching strategies, and efficient asset management.

    • Conducted cross-browser testing and E2E validation to ensure a seamless user experience across all platforms.

  • Go-Live & Maintenance

    • Oversaw deployment stages, collaborating with the QA and DevOps teams to ensure stable production delivery.

    • Provided post-launch adjustments for continuous UX and conversion improvements.

Achievements

  • Delivered a high-performance, visually compelling e-commerce front end for a major fashion retailer.

  • Improved page load speed and user engagement through refined UI design and efficient code structure.

  • Contributed to plugin modularity and scalability, reducing maintenance effort for future enhancements.

  • Helped elevate Bruno Banani‚Äôs digital presence with a consistent, modern brand experience.

Tech Stack

Frameworks & Tools: Shopware 6, Twig, SCSS, JavaScript (ES6), Webpack
Design Tools: Figma, Adobe XD
Version Control & Workflow: Git, Agile collaboration
Plugins & Features: Product configurator, promotional modules, advanced filtering
